name: Spiced D'Anjou Pear Bread
author: JAWANDMEE
summary: More like cake than bread, this 'plummy' creation is moist and delicious.  The pears and spices combine so tastily that I only bake this when there are other people around so I won't eat both loaves all by myself.
ingredients: 4  very firm D'Anjou pears, thinly sliced
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and generously grease two large loaf pans
(The long pieces of pear make the loaves more susceptible to sticking in the pans and falling apart, so make sure you grease the pans generously
) In a large bowl, combine brown sugar, vegetable oil, molasses, and eggs
Mix in salt, baking soda, cinnamon, cloves, ginger, and allspice
Stir the pear slices in, coating them evenly
Pour batter into the prepared loaf pans Bake for 50 to 65 minutes
Allow loaves to cool in pan about ten minutes before removing them and placing them on a wire rack to cool completely
